hypothesis: JAX autodiff enables exact gradients through the heat equation solver, allowing L-BFGS-B or Adam to optimize source parameters efficiently.

tuning_runs.finding: Explicit Euler requires dt < 0.002061 for stability, but original implicit ADI uses dt=0.004. JAX needs 3881 timesteps vs 1000 original to match physics.

abort_reason: JAX autodiff requires explicit time-stepping which has stability constraints incompatible with the problem's time scale. Explicit Euler needs 4x more timesteps to match implicit ADI accuracy, defeating any speed advantage.
